subject: Physical Fitness
title: Bodybuilding Goes Mainstream
description: Learn Bodybuilding Goes Mainstream in one minute.

hook.text: In 1977, a documentary called 'Pumping Iron' aired. A young Austrian named Arnold changed fitness forever.

buildup.text: Arnold Schwarzenegger made bodybuilding glamorous. Muscles went from circus novelty to Hollywood ideal.

discovery.text: The film drove gym memberships up 150% within two years. Weight rooms filled with people chasing the Arnold look.

twist.text: What the film didn't show: rampant steroid use. The physiques that inspired millions were chemically enhanced.

climax.text: The natural vs enhanced debate still divides fitness culture. Unrealistic standards affect body image globally.

punchline.text: Arnold made lifting cool. But the standards he set were never fully natural.

quiz.question: How did the film Pumping Iron impact fitness culture?
options: Gym memberships rose 150% and bodybuilding went mainstream
